title: Drawing, Project for the Coat of Arms of a Cardinal, ca. 1750
title_raw: Project for the Coat of Arms of a Cardinal
medium: Pencil, pen, black ink watercolor washes on paper
provenance: From the Collection of Giovanni Piancastelli
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: The escutcheon shows two eyes; it is topped by a diadem and two pastoral staffs and is held by two angels. Maltese cross behind the escutcheon. An angel holds a miter and a cardinal's hat on top. The supporting angel at right holds a standard with the crossed keys in his left hand; trophy of arms at the bottom.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Project for the Coat of Arms of a Cardinal, ca. 1750. Pencil, pen, black ink watercolor washes on paper. 
Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-3681
